I believe that we need to revisit the subject of fear. Fear is not a feeling. Fear is not a thought. Fear is not an imagination. Fear is not your circumstances. Fear is a person. He will always hide behind situations and circumstances so that we forget that it's a person. Fear is one of the strongest adversaries that the enemy uses. He releases that spirit called fear. When fear comes in, it opens you up to other things to come in. Fear can cause a crack, a little opening, and a little hole for the enemy to come in to kill, to steal, and to destroy. It doesn't matter how fortified one may be when fear sets in, there is an opening for the adversary to come in. If for whatever reason a particular day you are unable to fast, don't worry. Still pray, still do your prayers, still enforce the scriptures, and don't worry at all. Another opportunity will come for you to fast. Continue the prayers three times a day. I believe God against all opposition and against all contradiction that at the end of these 100 days of prayer and fasting that all the things that have buffeted you, afflicted you and the stubborn situations in your life, they will come to an end in the name of Jesus. For God has not given us the spirit of fear. Fear is a spirit and is one of the strongest weapons Satan deploys against everyone. There are about 700 different kinds of fear. Fear is a serpent with many, many, many heads. Victory over fear is the title of the message. That is what fear does. Fear will open you up and invite the adversary. It operates in many, many ways and it will torture your mind, your emotions, and compel you to speak death. As you begin to speak death, it invites the adversary to come in. Death and life are in the power of the tongue. Whatever words you speak, they are seed. Eventually, it will become a fruit that you have to eat yourself. So you got to watch what comes out of your mouth when you are afraid. Whatever you are afraid of is Satan's plan and agenda for your life. He's showing you his plans and desire and what he wishes and expects to befall you. But today, whatever plan Satan has for our lives, our loved ones, this house, and our nation, by divine authority on the account of the blood of Jesus Christ, let it be intercepted and arrested. Intercepted and arrested by the power of Jesus' name. It's very, very important when we are dealing with spiritual things for you to have an attitude of cooperation and faith to confront the enemy. But the thing which I greatly feared is come upon me and that which I was afraid of is come on. He said it twice.

For nine solid months, Job faced an affliction, an adversary that his friends and loved ones could not make sense of. At the end of the nine months of affliction, when he prayed, God turned his captivity. But Job then later on when he sat down and reflected came to the conclusion that everything that happened to him was a result of fear. The fear he had of losing everything he had was exactly what happened to him. But the thing which I greatly feared has come upon me. And that which I was afraid of has come onto me. Turn to somebody and say, "What are you afraid of?" You'll be surprised of the things they will tell you. Everybody has a fear of something. If it is not confronted and dealt with, it could have serious implications, not right now, but in the future. When people speak, you can also tell what they are afraid of; it's in their confession. Fear comes in to torture you mentally and emotionally and to harass you to get you to start speaking your fears. He projects, it plants and sows a seed. What if you die prematurely? What will happen to your kids? What if this thing you are attempting to do doesn't work? What if you lose your job? You have no idea the fear and the torture that goes on. The enemy comes in and will torture you mentally. I will go to wherever I'm going and I will arrive at my destination in safety and in one piece. And I will return in safety and in one piece. I declare victory over fear by confessing. This is my confession that whenever I leave my house and my dwelling to go anywhere, I will arrive safely at my final destination in one piece. And I'll return safely in one piece to my dwelling without fail in the name of Jesus. For I am free of fear. You have to let fear know that I am free of you. You have no power over me. Your inability to say it is an indication that you are a slave to it. I am not a slave to fear. I am free. I'm free of fear. I'm free of the spirit of fear. Job for nine months, he couldn't make sense of his pain. He could not make sense of his adversity. His friends and loved ones couldn't make sense of it. Everything that has happened to him was a result of the fear he had. It was exactly what he feared that came upon him. I renounce my fears. I renounce fear. Fear is not of God. I have no fear. For God has not given me a spirit of fear, but has given me power, love, and of a sound mind. I break the power of the spirit of fear over my life and future. I violently uproot and attack the very stronghold of fear in my subconscious mind, heart, soul, and spirit. You don't overcome fear by strong willpower. Positive thinking doesn't overcome fear because fear is a spirit. You conquer and overcome fear by the power of Jesus' name and by the scriptures indwelling you. Whenever you face challenges, what is in you will come out. What is in you will come out. That's why the word of God must dwell in you richly. Because when the enemy comes, none of the things we play with, we seek after, we go after can deliver you but the word of God. There's only one thing he fears the most.
